intro: Oldenlandia nematocaulis, commonly known as the slender knotweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical structure supports its role in local ecosystems, providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
